column4: Hey I was having a quick chat with one of my college profs. Hey suggested sudo -s instead of sudo su. Can anyone tell me the differences between the two?
Does anyone know the difference between Sudo su and Sudo -s off hand?
Sudo -s is basically as if you called sudo before every command after that until "exit". (logs you in as root)
sudo -s appears to have to do with the input of the password
